review_content: Really great dinner!  I would highly recommend  all of our food, including appetizers, dinners and desserts were very tasty. Warm and inviting atmosphere.
Food was amazing! Cioppino was amazing, arancini was delicious, the steak was 10/10! Great service and atmosphere. Would recommend!

My mother and I accidentally stumbled into the pink door about a year or so ago. We smelled it and followed our noses.  Now we are hooked.. We try to go to The Pink door whenever we see a show in Seattle. It's not easy to get in unless you have a reservation but the food is amazing. Their Bolognese is perfection. From the pasta to the sauce it is what all other Bolognese strives to be.

We also got the gnocchi with gorgonzola cream sauce and pomegranate. It is rich but the tangy pomegranate cuts it just right. And the gnocchi is pillowy and light.

Service is friendly as always. Atmosphere has some strange elements when it comes to decor but even with some of the strangeness, it's still cozy overall.

I already have a reminder set to book our next reservation.

A true Seattle treasure. Impeccably service, the most gorgeous food presentation and a lively but classy ambiance. The food was delicious & interesting (in the best way). Everything I hoped for and more!
Delicious food, so pretty looking out the window in the back part of the restaurant. Our server was delightful. Really lovely experience. Definitely will be back.
Eric was excellent and full of energy.  We both had the steak, which was delicious.  Overall, an A+ meal and setting.

The lasagna was amazing, but the Tuscan fries were disappointing … basically regular frozen fries with some large leaves on top and whole cloves of garlic sitting on the side (not presented in a way that you would eat it with the fries). The service was horrible. The hostess was extremely rude, and the rest of the staff seemed unhappy to be there and annoyed with having to help customers. The restaurant was cute inside but overall, I would not go there again. I would order the lasagna to-go if I could avoid the staff.

Two of enjoyed the market fish of the day: seared scallops with lentils, cauliflower puree and frisee. One ordered the gogonzola gnocchi with toasted walnuts and pomegranate. Our view table was perfect. Bravo to one of Seattle's classic restaurants.

This is my second visit to The Pink Door, and I am very happy to say it was just as lovely as the first. Beautiful food, ambience, and service. They do not rush you. We were given a great wine recommendation, and the food is delicious. Highly recommend!

What a pleasant experience! We had the pappardelle bolognese, cioppino, and the Caesar. They were all delicious. We especially loved the cioppino which had a mild tomatoey taste not fishy perfect to our taste. I rarely order cioppino at seafood restaurants but was pleasantly surprised. Definitely will be back.

The Pink Door has always been special but in recent years it has risen to perfection.  Every time I am in town, I make a point to stop in and it is always a flavor sensation.  Every dish they prepare is a treat to your taste buds.  The staff are great and the ambience is just right with the old world feel and new world spin.
Great food, Great service, highly recommend this restaurant.
Another great experience and amazing food!  Chefs kiss on the dessert as well!  Thanks for always offering great options and a true experience!

I almost always order from the special or seasonal menu, and this time was no exception. Winter salad, scallops, special drink and espresso. The ingredients are simple but masterfully prepared. A must try in Seattle!  We had a wonderful family lunch here.
Such a special place in Seattle. Professional staff, welcoming maitre d, and top quality dishes.

The menu was simple but not lacking, wasn’t an overwhelming amount to decide nor was it too small to not have options. The food was made at a high level with attention to detail and exquisite taste. We always wanted to visit but our days off are the days they are closed. We decided to get a reservation finally after seeing all the good reviews and TikTok’s. We had to wait 45 days to get the spot we wanted and patiently waited in anticipation. The anticipation was the only good thing we had about this visit. While we had a 5pm reservation we showed up at 440 and was told to wait at the bar as the dinning room was not ready yet and they would come get us. Bar tender was nice and drinks were good. As we waited we seen people behind us getting seated and finally at 520 we were seated in the middle of empty seating against a down stairway. Window seats open and other better seating was open but were stuck there and felt like an outcast. Server came and was nice but clearly didn’t know the menu was she kept looking at a note pad. Drink order placed and she left, came back with drinks 30 min later and asked if we made a decision. We ordered the salmon chefs special and pork chop. Waited another 30 min for food never checked on again and had empty glasses. Food came and was less then acceptable as we began tasting the food, pork chop was very good, greens were mushy and little baby potatoes were undercooked. Salmon was over cooked, what we thought were mashed potatoes were grainy and tasted like instant, the vegetable was unknown half burnt and soggy as well. Served came back 30’ish minutes later and asked if we were done. Took the 3/4 full plates as we said yes and she left, not asking if it was okay. First clue to ask was $80 in plates 1/4 eaten. Came back with a menu and said here are our deserts and quickly turned to the next table and started talking to them. Left and came back 15 minutes later asking if we wanted anything. We asked for check and was promptly brought to us. We paid and left not being asked anything or thanked for coming. Need less to say we will never be coming back and lots of friends have thought about going here but after our visit not sure.

The Pink Door is more than just a restaurant – it's an experience. From the moment you walk in, you'll be transported to a whimsical and romantic world filled with delicious food, fantastic drinks, and live entertainment. Located in Seattle's Pike Place Market, The Pink Door has been a local favorite for over 35 years, and it's not hard to see why.

The restaurant itself is a charming space filled with twinkling lights, colorful decor, and vintage photos adorning the walls. But the real draw is the food - the menu features a mix of classic Italian dishes and Pacific Northwest seafood, all made with fresh, local ingredients. The handmade pasta dishes are a standout, as are the wood-fired pizzas.

But it's not just the food that makes The Pink Door special - it's the atmosphere. The restaurant is known for its live entertainment, including aerial performances, cabaret shows, and live music. The performers often move throughout the restaurant, adding to the already immersive experience.

The drinks are also top-notch, with an impressive selection of Italian wines, creative cocktails, and local craft beers. And the service is always friendly and attentive, making you feel like a welcomed guest in someone's home.

The pasta melt in your mouth with the right balance of sauce, cheese and pasta.   

Desert - Tiramisu is not on the list!! What kind of Italian does not serve Tiramisu?  

Wine list - We all know restaurant charges 3 to 4x the cost of a bottle but even that, the selection was not that great.  One would think in the Pacific Northwest, especially Washington, there would be many great options, but nope!  A $68 bottle tasted like table wine that is less than $15 from Costco.  They also have some of these gimmicky drinks that look nice, but I doubt it's worth it.  Which is why we settle for a bottom of red.

In short, I would recommend folks go to other Italian restaurants such as Blu Sardinia (Redmond) or Spinasse in the Capital Hills district.
